thread.title: Shot fired over one man’s meat
thread.title_full: Shot fired over one man’s meat

title: Shot fired over one man’s meat
text:
Saturday, 18 February 2017 Shot fired over one man’s meat 
A GUEST at a bar in Thailand was shot after he was allegedly rejected by a prostitute who panicked over the size of his penis. 
China Press reported that the man, known only as Annop, was with several friends at a karaoke bar in Soi Sermsuk, Phuket, on Monday when he asked to take one of the hostesses to a back room for sex. 
He then paid the manager 2,500 baht (RM318). 
Moments later, the woman ran out of the room, screaming: “He is too big! I can’t do it! I’m scared!” 
This led to a scuffle between the manager, his co-workers and Annop, who insisted on getting his money’s worth. 
The fight escalated and the manager was punched in his face. 
The enraged manager then left but allegedly returned with a revolver and shot Annop in the abdomen. 
Police arrived later and arrested the manager for attempted murder and illegal possession of firearms. 
Annop was rushed to hospital for treatment. 
> The daily also reported that a South Korean man forced his wife and their son to predict winners in horse races by meditating. 
The man, known only as Seo, from Jeju Island, would assault the two when their predictions fell through. 
Seo, who has been convicted for child abuse, began forcing his wife to meditate and predict horse-racing winners in 2008 after his release from prison. 
The report said the man was a religious fanatic, convinced that meditation could enable devout believers to predict the future. 
When his wife ran away three years later, he forced his 13-year-old son to take over the role by locking him up in a room for up to 14 hours a day to meditate and reveal the names of the winning horses. 
Seo also reportedly hit the boy with a wooden sword when the boy failed to obey his orders. 
His acts were uncovered when his daughter ran away from home after witnessing what happened to her brother. 
Seo was later arrested and on Monday, was jailed four-and-a-half years by the local court, which castigated him for being the world’s worst father for committing inhumane and unspeakable acts against his children. 
> Found in translation is compiled from the vernacular newspapers (Bahasa Malaysia, Chinese and Tamil dailies). As such, stories are grouped according to the respective language/medium. Where a paragraph begins with a >, it denotes a separate news item.
